div.l: Loo Grenewych / that many a schewe is Inne
It we tyme / thi tale for to begynne
Now sires / ꝙquod this Oswolde the Reeve
I pay you al / that ye you nat greve
licitūm est vim vi repellereThouh I answere / and somdel set his howve
For leful is / wyth fors / fors of to showve
This dronken myller͗e hath I tolde vs here
How that begiled / was a Carpentere
Parauenture in skorne for I am on
And bi your leve / I shal him quyte a non̄
Ryht in his chirlyssh termys wol I speke
I pray to god his necke / mot y breke
He kan se wel / in myn eye a stalke
But in his owne he kan nat fynde a balke
Hic Incipit fabula prepositi.
AT trompyngtoıı̄un / nat fer fro Cambrygge
Ther goth a broke / and ovir that a brygge
Vppon whiche broke / the stant a mylle
And this is a verray soth / that y you telle
A myller͗e was ther / dwellyng many a day
As any pecok / he was stowt and gay
Pypen̄ he cowde / and Fysshen̄ and nettys bete
And turnen cuppys / and wel wrastelyn̄ and shete
Ay be is belte / he bar a long panade
In stede of Swerde / ful trenchant was the blade
